google_reviews.author: BH QE
google_reviews.review: Horrible property management company.  They didn't do thinks they said they would do to clean the house before I moved in, they made me wait weeks for every essential repair I ever requested and they charged me with huge fees that were not in any way warranted when I moved out which has hurt my credit report.  I would avoid them at all costs.  I would give them 0 stars if that was possible.

google_reviews.author: Ted Smith
google_reviews.review: We lived in a CPM house in Bellingham back when it was all we could afford.  It took us over a week to clean the place before we felt safe to move in because the house was absolutely filthy.  All of the outlets and garbage disposal were used up and I did all of the repair work because CPM would not respond. One Sunday morning the fire detector went off and we called the fire department because we smelled smoke. It turned out that the HVAC system didnt have a filter and was full of dust, which had caught fire.  When we were finally able to move out of this disaster, CPM charged us a $75 fee to clean the oven (which was filthy when we moved in) and when my 8-month pregnant wife went in to contest the charge, the manager wouldnt budge and told her he was charging us Because I can!  Female renters beware!  Sexist, chauvinistic, dominant male management that will treat you like the little woman!!!

google_reviews.author: B LH
google_reviews.review: I lived in a Chuckanut Property Managements rental for almost 2 years and the experience was terrible from beginning to end. Most importantly, they did not even respond to my requests for repairs for weeks. I had to get the name of the home owner via property records and contact him on LinkedIn and get him involved before they made any effort to repair things in the house. They left me with a broken refrigerator for weeks. They left a fence in the backyard down after a windstorm for over a month. I had to contact the owner every time for him to contact Chuckanut before they even acknowledged my requests. They didnt clean carpets or the house as promised before I moved in; the lady who did the lease signing with me was rude to my children and to myself. I moved out after proper notice, etc and after I moved out on the designated date and left the keys on the counter, they charged me for an additional months rent because when I moved out I didnt take the keys to their office. I left them on the kitchen counter as I have in rentals before. They also charged me various bogus charges after moving out. Chuckanut reported to credit agencies that I owed this extra month plus the bogus charges. Ive never experienced a worse property management company.

google_reviews.review: 5 stars for spelling the name wrong, yiu cant make this up!
